channel.description: Booting into Specific Targets RHEL boots into graphical target state by default if the Server with GUI software selection is made during installation. can also be directed to boot into non-default but less capable operating targets from the GRUB2 menu. offers emergency and rescue boot targets. special target levels can be launched from the GRUB2 interface by selecting a kernel pressing e to enter the edit mode appending the desired target name to the line that begins with the keyword “linux”. Press ctrl+x to boot into the supplied target Enter root password reboot when you are done You must know how to boot a RHEL 9 system into a specific target from the GRUB2 menu to modify the fstab file or reset an unknown root user password.
